original: Ericsson, Josef Martin, skådespelare, Göteborg, f. 31/5/9il i Sthlm av Per E. o. Sofia Ersdotter. — Stud. v. Elin Svenssons dramat, elevsk. 08-09. Eng. h. Ranft 09-11, v. Södra teatern i Sthlm 11-12, h. Wilh. Olin 12-13, Knut Lindroth 13-17, Allan Ryding 17-18, v. Lorensbergsteatern i Gbg 18-24, Ernst Eklunds teatrar i Sthlm 24-28, Stadsteatern i Hälsingborg 28, nu åter i Gbg. Bl. roller: Swedenhielm i Sw^edenhielms, Jago i Othello, Theo-dor i Dunungen, Roger Bernhusen i Hans nåds testamente, Adolf i Fordringsägare, Simon Petrus i Judas, Översten i Werfels Jacobov^sky o. översten, Pappa m. fl.
translated: Ericsson, Josef Martin, actor, Gothenburg, born May 31, 9il in Stockholm to Per E. and Sofia Ersdotter. Studied at Elin Svensson's drama school as a student during 08-09. Entered the Royal Dramatic Theatre School in Stockholm, under Ranft, during 09-11. Worked at Södra Teatern in Stockholm during 11-12, Wilh. Olin during 12-13, Knut Lindroth during 13-17, Allan Ryding during 17-18, Lorensbergsteatern in Gothenburg during 18-24, Ernst Eklund's theaters in Stockholm during 24-28, and Stadsteatern in Hälsingborg in 28. Currently back in Gothenburg. Notable roles include Swedenhielm in Swedenhielms, Jago in Othello, Theodore in Dunungen, Roger Bernhusen in His Grace's Will, Adolf in Creditors, Simon Peter in Judas, Colonel in Werfel's Jacobovsky and the Colonel, Daddy, among others.
